back.text:
Root: ق و ل (Q-W-L)
Meaning: Say
Pronunciation: Qul
Tajweed Rules: No qalqalah here (you stop on ل, which is not a qalqalah letter). ق is heavy (tafkhīm); clear sukun on ل when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. قَوْل (Qawl): Saying
2. قَالَ (Qāla): He said
3. مَقُول (Maqūl): That which is said
4. قَائِل (Qāʾil): A sayer
Example Ayah: وَقَالَ رَبُّكُمُ ادْعُونِي أَسْتَجِبْ لَكُمْ

Root: — (pronoun)
Meaning: He
Pronunciation: Huwa
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words: As a pronoun, it has no derived words.
Example Ayah: هُوَ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ

Root: أ ل ه (A-L-H)
Meaning: Allah
Pronunciation: Allāh
Tajweed Rules: Lām of “Allah” is heavy (tafkhīm) when preceded by fatḥah or ḍamma (as in هُوَ اللَّهُ), and light (tarqīq) when preceded by kasrah.
Derived Words:
1. إِلَٰه (Ilāh): A god, deity
2. أُلُوهِيَّة (Ulūhiyyah): Divinity
3. اللَّهُمَّ (Allāhumma): O Allah
4. تَأَلَّهَ (Taʾallaha): To worship
Example Ayah: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ

hint.text: The proper name for God in Islam.

back.text:
Root: و ح د (W-Ḥ-D)
Meaning: One, Unique
Pronunciation: Aḥad
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on د when stopping (…أَحَدْ).
Derived Words:
1. وَحْدَة (Waḥdah): Oneness
2. وَاحِد (Wāḥid): One
3. أَوْحَد (Awḥad): Unique
4. مُوَحِّد (Muwahhid): A monotheist
Example Ayah: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ

hint.text: The core message of the Sūrah.

back.text:
Root: ص م د (Ṣ-M-D)
Meaning: The Eternal Refuge, The Self-Sufficient
Pronunciation: Aṣ-Ṣamad
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām shamsiyyah (ل assimilates into ص); Ṣād is heavy (tafkhīm); qalqalah on د when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. صَمْد (Ṣamd): Refuge/being turned to
2. تَصْمِيد (Taṣmīd): Turning to for refuge
Example Ayah: This word is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: The One all turn to for their needs.

back.text:
Root: و ل د (W-L-D)
Meaning: He begets
Pronunciation: yalid
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on د when stopping (…يَلِدْ).
Derived Words:
1. وَلَد (Walad): A child
2. مَوْلِد (Mawlid): Birth
3. وِلَادَة (Wilādah): Childbirth
4. أَوْلَاد (Awlād): Children
Example Ayah: وَلَمْ يَلِدْ

hint.text: Part of the negation of Allah having offspring.

back.text:
Root: و ل د (W-L-D)
Meaning: He is begotten
Pronunciation: yūlad
Tajweed Rules: Madd ṭabīʿī on يُو (2 counts); qalqalah on د when stopping (…يُولَدْ).
Derived Words:
1. وَلَد (Walad): A child
2. مَوْلِد (Mawlid): Birth
3. وِلَادَة (Wilādah): Childbirth
4. أَوْلَاد (Awlād): Children
Example Ayah: وَلَمْ يُولَدْ

hint.text: The negation of Allah being born.

back.text:
Root: ك ف أ (K-F-ʾ)
Meaning: An equal, a match
Pronunciation: kufuwan
Tajweed Rules: Iẓhār ḥalqī of the tanwīn before hamzah in the next word (…كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ).
Derived Words:
1. كَفَاءَة (Kafāʾah): Competence
2. كُفْء (Kufʾ): An equal/match
3. أَكْفَاء (Akfāʾ): Equals
Example Ayah: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ

hint.text: Affirms that nothing is comparable to Allah.
